column4: Oh no! I cant run the Ubuntu 9.10 liveCD because I think it has compiz enabled and that doesnt work on my machine. But when I boot from a hardy disk I cant mount my ext4 partitions. Can I get a livecd that doesnt have compiz?
uninstall the driver it is using which will make it use vesa and not allow compiz
Thanks. But I cant get that far as the graphics are screwed. Could I do ctrl alt F1 from a live cd to get to a terminal?
if you can do it in an installed system, yes
you'll need to restart the x server but you should be fine
The other thing is I understand Ctrl Alt Backspace doesnt work anymore so now I dont know hot to restart x
Thanks. I guess I need to make a customised livecd
alt k printscreen does not restart X. It tries to take a screen snapshot
Thanks. I was just wondering if there was a restartx command. I'll have a look in the wiki
